prs.title: op-deployer: Remove UseInterop flag from intent
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

Removes `UseInterop` from op-deployer intents. It is now inferred from whether the interop fork is set to genesis on the L2 chain. It only changes whether the interop predeploys are included in the generated L2 genesis and whether a dependency set is configured - which was the case before this PR, it was passed to DeployImplementations but never actually used.

Remaining steps

commits.message:
Remove the limit from the event debug info implementation.

It doesn't seem like this provides any tangible safety benefits, as events are already charged to budget (or shadow budget) and Debug is only used for tests or verbose logging in Core. If a consumer is concerned about the amount of data output, it would make more sense to limit to overall size of the output buffer.

prs.title: Scale shadow CPU limit in simulation 10x, shadow memory limit 2x.
prs.truncated_body:
### What

Scale shadow CPU limit in simulation 10x, shadow memory limit 2x.

This picks up a commit released in the 22.1.4 release of env.

### Why

Shadow limit has never been meant as a hard limit that would cause the simulation to fail. However, since module cache emulation is now off-loaded to the shadow budget, it became relatively easy to hit the shadow budget limit by doing repeated

commits.message:
Scale shadow CPU limit in simulation 10x, shadow memory limit 2x.

Shadow limit has never been meant as a hard limit that would cause the simulation to fail. However, since module cache emulation is now off-loaded to the shadow budget, it became relatively easy to hit the shadow budget limit by doing repeated calls to the same contract (which is now cheap for the actual 'enforcing' mode).

Eventually this may become a setting, but that would be nicer to do with a breaking change in the simulation API in order to not duplicate the interfaces.

commits.message: Removed peer authenticated assert in Floodgate::broadcast

Removed peer authenticated assert in Floodgate::broadcast (#4680)

# Description

Resolves https://github.com/stellar/stellar-core-internal/issues/335

This PR removes an expensive assert in `Floodgate::broadcast`. This
assert had to acquire `mStateMutex` from the main thread, but would
often be blocked by the background thread. During periods of high load
(1850 TPS), waiting for this mutex would double the median time of
broadcast. Because a peer's authenticated state can only be changed from
the mainthread anyway, the assert was replaced with a lockless main
thread assert. During testing at 1850 TPS, this change resulted in a 15%
decrease of txset fetch time, as well as a 10% decrease in nomination
latency.


# Checklist
- [x] Reviewed the
[contributing](https://github.com/stellar/stellar-core/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-changes)
document

actually want to enable this in prod, we can switch to proper XDR then.

Add config option to skip some validator checks for testing

This change adds a config option to skip the following checks on HIGH
and CRITICAL validators/orgs:
* That these orgs consist of at least 3 validators
* That these validators have history archives.

This option is only available on test builds. It is useful in
supercluser where we may want to test application-specific
functionality without spinning up fully valid networks.

Remove redundant loads from checkValid path (#4704)

# Description

This change refactor transaction and operation `checkValid` to reduce
the number of redundant loads. Initially, TransactionFrame cached source
accounts, making loads cheap. This resulted in calling load 3-4 times
during check valid. However, that cache has been removed, resulting in
reading from disk 3-4 times per call to checkValid.

Disable ltx cache when all state is in memory

Disable LTX cache when BucketList is in memory (#4706)

# Description

This change disables the LTX cache when all BucketList state is in
memory. This cache is not useful, since the load time of in-memory
BucketList entries is similar to loading from the random eviction cache,
and incurs significant overhead at high TPS.

**Description**:

With this PR we use `com.hedera.hashgraph` as **Maven Group** for all modules published from this repository. This allow us to keep Modules that already exist in that group as they are. All other Modules – `com.swirlds` and new `org.hiero` – are moved from the `com.swirlds` group to the `com.hedera.hashgraph` group with this PR.

Publishing in then simplified and can be perfo

commits.message:
chore: publish all HCN Modules in the same Maven group

As group, we use `com.hedera.hashgraph` as this allow us to keep
Modules that already exist in that group as they are. All other Modules
- `com.swirlds` and new `org.hiero` – are moved from the `com.swirlds`
group to the `com.hedera.hashgraph` with this PR.

Publishing can then be performed in one step.

This unified the publishing to one group/staging repo. This will make
it simpler to eventually move everything to the new `org.hiero` group.

prs.title: Update EIP712 upgradeable patch file
prs.truncated_body:
<!-- Thank you for your interest in contributing to OpenZeppelin! -->

This PR fixes issue #5607 by updating the misleading comment in the EIP712 contract that incorrectly refers to "immutable values" in the upgradeable version.

As suggested by @Amxx, I've replaced the comment with:
> NOTE: The upgradeable version of this contract does not use an immutable cache and recomputes the domain sep

commits.message:
docs: update EIP712 upgradeable comment in patch file

Fix misleading comment in EIP712Upgradeable by updating the comment in the transpilation patch file. The previous comment incorrectly referred to immutable values that don't exist in the upgradeable version.

The patch file has also been cleaned of trailing whitespace.
Update `EIP712` upgradeable comment in patch file
